result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander T Mickelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Cash bond of $500 is applied toward financial obligation owed - BALANCE DUE = $386

The defendant is to pay $100 per month with the first payment due 4-25-16 and each subsequent payment will be due the 25th of every month thereafter until paid in full

If the defendant pays the financial obligation in full and does not have any criminal convictions within one year of today's date, the record will be given 973.015 treatment.  Record will be given 973.015 treatment upon payment in full, even if it is before the one year is done
.
